tree_elements.text: First, I would like to thank you for writing this piece.

As you’ve mentioned, the urge to cheat has not entirely subsided, and there are some workarounds that teachers are doing that I would like to highlight. Many science teachers have decided to combat cheating by allowing it. These teachers allow for all their tests to be open-note, with no catch. While this may seem counterintuitive, this plan motivates students to actively take notes in class and focus. On top of this, the stigma that comes with cheating is alleviated and the test taker is more inclined to look at their notes than to scour the internet for answers and explanations that they can copy and paste from.

Because of last year’s pass/fail policy, people have associated virtual school with being effortless. And with that, it’s not crazy to hypothesize that cheating rates are going up. The truth is that if we don’t encourage learning, we’ll fail as a school district.
